rooms.description: A spacious living room designed with Kerala-style motifs and natural stone flooring to create a warm ambiance. Vastu principles: positioned in the north-east corner for positive energy.

An adjoining dining area integrated into the living space, featuring traditional wooden furniture and minimalistic decor to reflect Kerala aesthetics. Vastu principles: placed adjacent to living room for harmony.
A functional kitchen with a central island counter, designed in Kerala style using local materials and open ventilation following Vastu norms (north-east or north-facing).
A master bedroom with en-suite bathroom. Traditional Kerala design elements such as tiled roof and locally sourced wood accents are used, ensuring Vastu alignment (south-east for stability).
Secondary bedroom optimized for space efficiency with built-in storage, reflecting Kerala aesthetic and budget-friendly finishes. Vastu principle: placed in the south-west to balance energy.
Tertiary bedroom designed as a home office or guest room, with built-in desk space and ample natural light. Kerala elements are integrated subtly while remaining practical for dual usage.
Well-ventilated bathroom attached to the master bedroom. Designed with traditional Kerala finishes and efficient water fixtures, adhering to Vastu (south-east or south-west).

openings.description: Main entrance door designed in Kerala style with intricate carvings and a wide opening for ease of movement. Vastu aligned to face north-east to welcome positive energy.
Large balcony window overlooking the garden area, integrating traditional Kerala lattice work to maintain privacy while allowing natural light and ventilation.
Secondary entrance for service utilities and storage access.

budget_notes: Design optimized to maximize space utility and use locally available materials to maintain a tight budget. Some traditional Kerala design elements have been simplified or omitted where cost could be prohibitive, ensuring overall adherence to Vastu principles.
